content.text: is designed to process and parse billing data for accounts that have billing periods spanning multiple periods. It operates within the
schema and focuses on distributing billing amounts, therms, and CCF (hundred cubic feet of gas) across these spanned periods. The procedure uses a cursor to iterate over records in the

is greater than one, indicating that the billing spans multiple periods. It calculates and distributes the billing amounts and usage metrics proportionally across these periods and inserts the parsed data into the
The complexity of this stored procedure is high due to several factors:
It involves multiple calculations and transformations of data.
It uses a cursor to iterate over large datasets.
It involves complex business logic for distributing billing amounts and usage metrics.
It interacts with multiple user-defined functions and tables, which adds layers of complexity.
: The ID of the authenticated user executing the procedure.
: Represents the billing cycle, which is used in calculations and determining billing periods.
: The procedure declares numerous variables to hold data from the current record and intermediate calculations.
is declared to fetch records from
The cursor iterates over each record, fetching data into local variables.
It calculates the total gas spanned billed percentage using a user-defined function.
It initializes counters and sums for distributing the billing amounts and usage metrics.
A loop distributes the billing amounts and usage metrics across the periods, calculating monthly percentages and applying them to the amounts.
For each period, it inserts a record into
It updates the billing period revision and dates for the next iteration.
: After the loop, it processes the last period separately to account for any remaining amounts due to rounding.
: The cursor is closed and deallocated after processing all records.
: The use of a cursor can lead to performance bottlenecks, especially if the dataset is large. Cursors are slower than set-based operations.
: The procedure involves multiple calculations and function calls, which can be computationally expensive.
: Depending on the size of the
table and the presence of indexes, the initial SELECT statement for the cursor results in a table scan.
: The procedure involves rounding operations, which might lead to small discrepancies in the distributed amounts.
: If multiple instances of this procedure are run simultaneously, there could be issues with data consistency or locking.
: The procedure lacks explicit error handling, which could lead to unhandled exceptions and incomplete data processing.
: The procedure relies on several user-defined functions, which could introduce additional points of failure or performance issues if not optimized.
: The procedure assumes that the data in the source table is accurate and complete. Any discrepancies in the source data could lead to incorrect calculations and results.

-- =============================================
-- Author:		<Author,,Name>
-- Create date: <Create Date,,>
-- Description:	<Description,,>
-- =============================================
CREATE PROCEDURE [NationalGridWest].[usp_LegacyData_ParseSpannedAccountInfo] 
	@BillingPeriod varchar(6),
	@authenticatedID int,
	@BillingCycle varchar(1)
AS
BEGIN
	/*
2. Parse Spanned Billed uploaded
*/

--************************************************************************************** 
--Declare Variables                                            
--**************************************************************************************
--
declare @UploadAccountTempSummarySpannedSeqid dbo.seqid
--
declare @Notes dbo.notes
declare @AccountNumber dbo.acctnum
declare @FacilityName dbo.UtilityServiceAccountName
declare @ServiceAddress dbo.addr
declare @TariffCode dbo.tariff
declare @PostingDate dbo.PostingDate
--
declare @NumberOfPeriodsMinusOne dbo.Accumulator
declare @DeltaNumberOfPeriods dbo.Accumulator

declare @FirstPeriodCanceled dbo.yyyymm 
declare @ThermFactor dbo.ThermsFactor 
declare @FudgedThermFactor dbo.ThermsFactor 
declare @BillingPeriodRevision dbo.yyyymm 
declare @FromDate dbo.yyyymmdd 
declare @ToDate dbo.yyyymmdd 
declare @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision dbo.yyyymm 
declare @CalculatedFromDate dbo.yyyymmdd 
declare @CalculatedToDate dbo.yyyymmdd 
declare @BilledAmount dbo.BillingAmt 
declare @BilledAmountMonthly dbo.BillingAmt 
declare @BilledAmountMonthlySum dbo.BillingAmt 
declare @BilledAmountAverage dbo.BillingAmt 
declare @BilledAmountRemainder dbo.BillingAmt 
declare @BillingPeriodDays dbo.Accumulator 
declare @BillingPeriodDaysAverage dbo.Accumulator 
declare @BillingPeriodDaysRemainder dbo.Accumulator 
declare @Therms dbo.EnergyUnit 
declare @LastPeriodTherms dbo.EnergyUnit 
declare @ThermsAverage dbo.EnergyUnit 
declare @ThermsRemainder dbo.EnergyUnit 
declare @CCF dbo.EnergyUnit 
declare @CCFAverage dbo.EnergyUnit 
declare @CCFRemainder dbo.EnergyUnit 
declare @SumAverageCCF dbo.EnergyUnit 
declare @idx int
declare @StartingBillingPeriodDaysIncrement int
declare @StartingBillingPeriodCCFIncrement int
declare @StartingBillingPeriodThermsIncrement int
declare @IncrementBillingPeriodDays int
declare @IncrementBillingPeriodCCF int
declare @IncrementBillingPeriodTherms int
-- 
declare @BilledAmountMonthlyLastPeriod dbo.BillingAmt
declare @ThermsMonthlyLastPeriod dbo.EnergyUnit 
declare @CCFMonthlyLastPeriod dbo.EnergyUnit 

declare @UtilityCode dbo.seqid
declare @ApplyMonthlyPercentage  dbo.DiscountPercentage
declare @ThermsMonthlySum  dbo.EnergyUnit 
declare @ThermsMonthly  dbo.EnergyUnit 
declare @CCFMonthly  dbo.EnergyUnit 
declare @CCFMonthlySum  dbo.EnergyUnit 
declare @TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage dbo.DiscountPercentage


--**************************************************************************************  
--SET DEFAULTS                                                  
--**************************************************************************************


set @UtilityCode = 2


--**************************************************************************************  
--Main Process                                      
--**************************************************************************************

--	DECLARE a cursor to find all account bills that span more than one period.
DECLARE SpannedGasBillCursor CURSOR FOR
SELECT UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountTempSummarySpannedSeqid FROM NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountTempSummarySpanned
where (DeltaNumberOfPeriods > 1)

OPEN SpannedGasBillCursor; -- open curser

FETCH NEXT FROM SpannedGasBillCursor INTO @UploadAccountTempSummarySpannedSeqid
--
-- Check @@FETCH_STATUS to see if there are any more rows to fetch.
--
WHILE @@FETCH_STATUS = 0
BEGIN -- begin processing for fetched record
	
	/*
		1. set value for variables for parsing purposes
	*/	
	SELECT  
		@DeltaNumberOfPeriods=DeltaNumberOfPeriods,  
		@BillingPeriodRevision=BillingPeriodRevision, 
		@FirstPeriodCanceled=FirstPeriodCanceled, 
		@FromDate=FromDate,
		@ToDate=ToDate,
		@BilledAmount=BilledAmount, 
		@CCF=CCF, 
		@Therms=Therms, 
		@ThermFactor=ThermFactor,
		@BillingPeriodDays=BillingPeriodDays,
		@BillingPeriod = BillingPeriod,
		@AccountNumber=AccountNumber,
		@FacilityName=FacilityName,
		@ServiceAddress =ServiceAddress,
		@TariffCode=TariffCode,
		@PostingDate=PostingDate
	FROM NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountTempSummarySpanned
	WHERE   (UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountTempSummarySpannedSeqid = @UploadAccountTempSummarySpannedSeqid) 

	/*
		2. Distribute over spanned based on given percentage
	*/

	-- 2.1 periodAggregate the average City wide monthly gas usage percentage for the spanned row billing periods 
	select @TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage= dbo.[CalculateTotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage] (@BillingCycle,@DeltaNumberOfPeriods,@FirstPeriodCanceled,@BillingPeriodRevision)
		
	-- 2.2 Determine the number of periods minus 1 to pro-rate the money and usage.  The last period will derive the money and usage
	--	by row totals - (the n-1 aggregates of money and usage)
	set @NumberOfPeriodsMinusOne = @DeltaNumberOfPeriods-1


	--
	--	2.3 Initialize the counters for the n-1 parses
	--
	set @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision = @FirstPeriodCanceled
	set @CalculatedFromDate = @FromDate
	set @CalculatedToDate = @ToDate
	set @idx = 0
	set @BilledAmountMonthlySum = 0.00
	set @ThermsMonthlySum = 0
	set @CCFMonthlySum = 0
	--
	
	--- 2.4 distribute / parse
	while (@NumberOfPeriodsMinusOne > @idx)
	Begin 

		-- 2.4.1 set value for required variables

		-- The @ApplyMonthlyPercentage holds the weigthed average for the particular month
		select @ApplyMonthlyPercentage = [dbo].[CalculateApplyMonthlyPercentageGasSpannedBilled] (@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,@TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage)

		--
		-- Apply the Monthly Percentage to the CCF,Therms and Billed Amount and accumulate the weigthed average units.
		--
		set @BilledAmountMonthly = ROUND(@BilledAmount * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,2)
		set @BilledAmountMonthlySum = @BilledAmountMonthlySum + @BilledAmountMonthly
		set @ThermsMonthly = ROUND(@Therms * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,0)
		set @ThermsMonthlySum = @ThermsMonthlySum + @ThermsMonthly
		set @CCFMonthly = ROUND(@CCF * @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,0)
		set @CCFMonthlySum = @CCFMonthlySum + @CCFMonthly
		--
		--	The Billing Period Projected "ToDate" is derived from the table "dbo.BillingPeriodProjected" using the utility company seqid and the
		--	RevisedBillingPeriod and using the "EndofPeriodTodate" as the derived "Todate" for the account.
		--
		select @CalculatedToDate=
			NationalGridWest.DeterminActualDate(@AccountNumber, 'T', @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, @BillingCycle)

		if(@CalculatedToDate is null)
			select @CalculatedToDate = NationalGridWest.DetermineProjectedDate(@BillingCycle, @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, 'T', substring(@AccountNumber,12,2)) 
		

		-- 2.4.2	Create a custom note that explains how the information was parsed and what was the original information of the spanned row.
		--	It will note in EC3 that the transaction was derived.
		select @Notes = SUBSTRING('Therm factor '+cast(@ThermFactor as varchar(6))+
		' for '+cast(@DeltaNumberOfPeriods as varchar(6))+' First: '+@FirstPeriodCanceled +' ( '+@FromDate+') Last: '+ 
		@BillingPeriodRevision +' ( '+@FromDate+'). '+' period: '+@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision+ ' Month %: '+cast(@ApplyMonthlyPercentage as varchar(10))+
		' - Total %: '+cast(@TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage as varchar(10)), 1, 300)

		--
		-- 2.4.3  INSERT the data into the summary table
		--		
		INSERT INTO NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountSummary
			(
				AccountUtilityCompanySeqid, 
				OriginalAccountNumber, 
				NumberOfRebillTransactions, 
				NumberOfTransactions, 
				DerivedFromSpannedBill,
				BillingPeriod, 
				BillingPeriodRevision, 
				FirstCanceledBillingPeriod, 
				EstimatedOrActualBilling, 
				InitialCancelFromDate, 
				CurrentBillingToDate, 
				NumberOfBillingPeriods, 
				TotalBillingDaysRebilled, 
				TotalRebilledAmount, 
				TotalCanceledAmount, 
				PriorRevisedBilledAmount, 
				RevisedBilledAmount, 
				CanceledBilledAmount, 
				AverageRebillCostOfGasCharge,
				AverageRebillThermsFactor, 
				BillingDays, 
				BillingDate, 
				FromDate, 
				ToDate, 
				BillingAction, 
				ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod, 				
				GasRateCode, 
				DeliveryChargeAmount,
				TotalCCF, 
				TotalTherms, 
				ThermsFactor, 				
				CancelFromDate, 
				CancelToDate, 
				CancelDeliveryChargeAmount,
				CancelTotalCCF, 
				CancelTotalTherms, 
				CancelThermsFactor, 
				ProcessEffectiveDate, 
				Notes,			    
				SpannedBillingPeriodRevision,
				SpannedFirstCanceledBillingPeriod,
				SpannedBilledAmount,
				SpannedCCF,
				SpannedThermFactor,
				SpannedTherm,
				SpannedMonthlyPercentage,
				SpannedTotalPercentage,
				AuthenticatedUserID,
				DateAdded,
				LastUpdate,
				FacilityName,
				ServiceAddress
			)
			SELECT 
				@UtilityCode, 
				@AccountNumber,  --  UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.AccountNumber,   
				1, --  NumberOfRebillTransactions
				1, --  NumberOfTransactions
				'Y',  -- DerivedFromSpannedBill = 'Y'
				BillingPeriod, 
				@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, -- UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.BillingPeriodRevision, 
				@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, -- UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.FirstPeriodCanceled, 
				EstimatedOrActual,  -- EstimatedOrActualBilling needs to be updated
				@FromDate,  -- FromDate AS InitialCancelFromDate, 
				@ToDate, --  ToDate AS CurrentBillingToDate,
				1, --UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.DeltaNumberOfPeriods, 
				[dbo].[CalculateNumberOfBillingDays]  (@CalculatedFromDate,@CalculatedToDate), -- UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.BillingPeriodDays AS TotalBillingDaysRebilled, 
				@BilledAmountMonthly, --  UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.BilledAmount AS TotalRebilledAmount, 
				0, -- IsNull(UploadConEdisonCancellationTempSummary.CancelBilledAmount,0) AS TotalCanceledAmount,
				0 AS PriorRevisedBilledAmount,
				0, --  IsNull(UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.BilledAmount, 0), 
				0, -- IsNull(UploadConEdisonCancellationTempSummary.CancelBilledAmount,0), 
				0 AS AverageRebillCostOfGasCharge, 
				1.00 AS AverageRebillThermsFactor, 
				[dbo].[CalculateNumberOfBillingDays] (@CalculatedFromDate,@CalculatedToDate), -- IsNull(UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.BillingPeriodDays,0), 
				[dbo].ConvertDateToYYYYMMDD (@PostingDate), -- BillingDate
				@CalculatedFromDate,  -- UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.FromDate ,
				@CalculatedToDate, -- UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.ToDate, 
				CASE WHEN @BillingPeriod = @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision THEN 'O' ELSE 'A' END, -- 'O' as BillingAction, --@BillingPeriod
				'N' AS ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod, 
				TariffCode, 
				@BilledAmountMonthly, --  IsNull(UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.BilledAmount,0) AS DeliveryChargeAmount, 
				@CCFMonthly, --  IsNull(UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.CCF,0) AS TotalCCF, 
				@ThermsMonthly, --  IsNull(UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.Therms,0) AS TotalTherms, 
				CASE @CCFMonthly WHEN 0 THEN 1.0000 ELSE round(@ThermsMonthly*1.0 / @CCFMonthly,4) END,--  IsNull(UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.ThermFactor,1.0) AS ThermsFactor,
				null, --  UploadConEdisonCancellationTempSummary.CancelFromDate, 
				null, --  UploadConEdisonCancellationTempSummary.CancelToDate, 
				0, --  IsNull(UploadConEdisonCancellationTempSummary.CancelBilledAmount,0) AS CancelDeliveryChargeAmount, 
				0, --  IsNull(UploadConEdisonCancellationTempSummary.CancelCCF,0) AS CancelTotalCCF, 
				0, --  IsNull(UploadConEdisonCancellationTempSummary.CancelTherms,0) AS CancelTotalTherms, 
				1.0, --  IsNull(UploadConEdisonCancellationTempSummary.CancelThermFactor,1.0) AS CancelThermsFactor
				[dbo].ConvertDateToYYYYMMDD (GETDATE()), -- ProcessEffectiveDate
				@Notes,
			    @BillingPeriodRevision,
			    @FirstPeriodCanceled,
			    @BilledAmount,
			    @CCF,
			    @ThermFactor,
			    @Therms,
			    @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,
			    @TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage,
			    @authenticatedID,
			    GETDATE(),
			    GETDATE(),
			    FacilityName,
			    ServiceAddress
			FROM     NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountTempSummarySpanned
			WHERE   (UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountTempSummarySpannedSeqid = @UploadAccountTempSummarySpannedSeqid) 
		
			
			
			--
			--	Set up for the next the Revised Billing Period row.
			--
			set @SumAverageCCF = @SumAverageCCF + @CCFAverage 
			--
			--	Calculate the next the Revised Billing Period row.
			select @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision = [dbo].[CalculateNextBillingPeriod]  (@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,@BillingCycle)
			--	This will derive the new Revised Billing Period row's "FromDate"
			-- select @CalculatedFromDate = [dbo].[DetermineConEdisonBillingPeriodProjectedFromDate](@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,@TariffCode,@UtilityCode)
				
			select @CalculatedFromDate=
			NationalGridWest.DeterminActualDate(@AccountNumber, 'F', @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, @BillingCycle)

			if(@CalculatedFromDate is null)
				select @CalculatedFromDate = NationalGridWest.DetermineProjectedDate(@BillingCycle, @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, 'F', substring(@AccountNumber,12,2)) 
			
		set @idx = @idx + 1
	end -- end distribute/parse


	--
	--	2.4.4 Finish up the last period's processing
	--
	--	Use the (Nth -1) periods @CalculatedToDate as the "FromDate" and the acutal "ToDate" from the spanned record as the "ToDate"
	--
	select @CalculatedFromDate = @CalculatedToDate
	select @CalculatedToDate = @ToDate
	--
	--	@ApplyMonthlyPercentage is used for the notes purposes only
	--
	select @ApplyMonthlyPercentage = [dbo].[CalculateApplyMonthlyPercentageGasSpannedBilled] (@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision,@TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage)
	--
	--	Derive the net changes to avoid rounding errors
	--
	set @BilledAmountMonthlyLastPeriod = @BilledAmount - @BilledAmountMonthlySum
	set @ThermsMonthlyLastPeriod = @Therms - @ThermsMonthlySum
	set @CCFMonthlyLastPeriod = @CCF  - @CCFMonthlySum

	--
	--	Create a custom note that explains how the information was parsed and what was the original information of the spanned row.
	--	It will note in EC3 that the transaction was derived.
	--
	select @Notes = SUBSTRING('Therm factor '+cast(@ThermFactor as varchar(6))+
	' for '+cast(@DeltaNumberOfPeriods as varchar(6))+' First: '+@FirstPeriodCanceled +' ( '+@FromDate+') Last: '+ 
	@BillingPeriodRevision +' ( '+@FromDate+'). '+' period: '+@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision+ ' Month %: '+cast(@ApplyMonthlyPercentage as varchar(10))+
	' - Total %: '+cast(@TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage as varchar(10)), 1, 300)	

	--
	--	INSERT the data into the table "NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountSummary"
	--
	INSERT INTO NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountSummary
		(AccountUtilityCompanySeqid, 
		OriginalAccountNumber, 
		NumberOfRebillTransactions, 
		NumberOfTransactions, 
		DerivedFromSpannedBill,
		BillingPeriod, 
		BillingPeriodRevision, 
		FirstCanceledBillingPeriod, 
		EstimatedOrActualBilling, 
		InitialCancelFromDate, 
		CurrentBillingToDate, 
		NumberOfBillingPeriods, 
		TotalBillingDaysRebilled, 
		TotalRebilledAmount, 
		TotalCanceledAmount, 
		PriorRevisedBilledAmount, 
		RevisedBilledAmount, 
		CanceledBilledAmount, 
		AverageRebillCostOfGasCharge,
		AverageRebillThermsFactor, 
		BillingDays, 
		BillingDate, 
		FromDate, 
		ToDate, 
		BillingAction, 
		ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod, 
		GasRateCode, 
		DeliveryChargeAmount,
		TotalCCF, 
		TotalTherms, 
		ThermsFactor, 
		CancelFromDate, 
		CancelToDate, 
		CancelDeliveryChargeAmount,
		CancelTotalCCF, 
		CancelTotalTherms, 
		CancelThermsFactor, 
		ProcessEffectiveDate, 
		Notes,
		SpannedBillingPeriodRevision,
		SpannedFirstCanceledBillingPeriod,
		SpannedBilledAmount,
		SpannedCCF,
		SpannedThermFactor,
		SpannedTherm,
		SpannedMonthlyPercentage,
		SpannedTotalPercentage,
		AuthenticatedUserID,
		DateAdded,
		LastUpdate,
		FacilityName,
		ServiceAddress
		)
	SELECT 
		@UtilityCode,
		@AccountNumber,  --  UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.AccountNumber,
		1, --  NumberOfRebillTransactions
		1, --  NumberOfTransactions
		'Y',  -- DerivedFromSpannedBill = 'Y'
		BillingPeriod, 
		@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, -- UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.BillingPeriodRevision, 
		@CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision, -- UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.FirstPeriodCanceled, 
		EstimatedOrActual,  -- EstimatedOrActualBilling needs to be upodated
		@FromDate,  -- UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.FromDate AS InitialCancelFromDate, 
		@ToDate, --  UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.ToDate AS CurrentBillingToDate,
		[dbo].[CalculateDeltaBillingPeriods] (
			NationalGridWest.DetermineBillingPeriod(@BillingCycle, @CalculatedFromDate, 'F', substring(@AccountNumber,12,2)),
			NationalGridWest.DetermineBillingPeriod(@BillingCycle, @CalculatedToDate, 'T', substring(@AccountNumber,12,2)),
			@BillingCycle
		), --UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.DeltaNumberOfPeriods, 
		[dbo].[CalculateNumberOfBillingDays]  (@CalculatedFromDate,@CalculatedToDate), -- UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.BillingPeriodDays AS TotalBillingDaysRebilled, 
		@BilledAmountMonthlyLastPeriod, --  UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.BilledAmount AS TotalRebilledAmount, 
		0, -- IsNull(UploadConEdisonCancellationTempSummary.CancelBilledAmount,0) AS TotalCanceledAmount,
		0 AS PriorRevisedBilledAmount,
		@BilledAmountMonthly, --  IsNull(UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.BilledAmount, 0), 
		0, -- IsNull(UploadConEdisonCancellationTempSummary.CancelBilledAmount,0), 
		0 AS AverageRebillCostOfGasCharge, 
		1.00 AS AverageRebillThermsFactor, 
		[dbo].[CalculateNumberOfBillingDays]  (@CalculatedFromDate,@CalculatedToDate), --IsNull(UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.BillingPeriodDays,0), 
		[dbo].ConvertDateToYYYYMMDD (@PostingDate), -- BillingDate
		@CalculatedFromDate,  -- UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.FromDate ,
		@CalculatedToDate, -- UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.ToDate, 
		CASE WHEN @BillingPeriod = @CalculatedBillingPeriodRevision THEN 'O' ELSE 'A' END, -- 'O' as BillingAction, 
		'N' AS ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod, 
		TariffCode, 
		@BilledAmountMonthlyLastPeriod, --  IsNull(UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.BilledAmount,0) AS DeliveryChargeAmount, 
		@CCFMonthlyLastPeriod, --  IsNull(UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.CCF,0) AS TotalCCF, 
		@ThermsMonthlyLastPeriod, --  IsNull(UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.Therms,0) AS TotalTherms, 
		CASE @CCFMonthlyLastPeriod WHEN 0 THEN 0 ELSE round(@ThermsMonthlyLastPeriod*1.0 / @CCFMonthlyLastPeriod,4) END,--  IsNull(UploadConEdisonAccountTempSummarySPanned.ThermFactor,1.0) AS ThermsFactor,
		null, --  UploadConEdisonCancellationTempSummary.CancelFromDate, 
		null, --  UploadConEdisonCancellationTempSummary.CancelToDate, 
		0, --  IsNull(UploadConEdisonCancellationTempSummary.CancelBilledAmount,0) AS CancelDeliveryChargeAmount, 
		0, --  IsNull(UploadConEdisonCancellationTempSummary.CancelCCF,0) AS CancelTotalCCF, 
		0, --  IsNull(UploadConEdisonCancellationTempSummary.CancelTherms,0) AS CancelTotalTherms, 
		1.0, --  IsNull(UploadConEdisonCancellationTempSummary.CancelThermFactor,1.0) AS CancelThermsFactor
		[dbo].ConvertDateToYYYYMMDD (GETDATE()), -- ProcessEffectiveDate
		@Notes,
	    @BillingPeriodRevision,
	    @FirstPeriodCanceled,
	    @BilledAmount,
	    @CCF,
	    @ThermFactor,
	    @Therms,
	    @ApplyMonthlyPercentage,
	    @TotalGasSpannedBilledPercentage,
		@authenticatedID,
		GETDATE(),
		GETDATE(),
		FacilityName,
		ServiceAddress
	FROM NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountTempSummarySpanned
	WHERE   (UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountTempSummarySpannedSeqid = @UploadAccountTempSummarySpannedSeqid) 

	--
	--	Process the next row
	--
	FETCH NEXT FROM SpannedGasBillCursor INTO @UploadAccountTempSummarySpannedSeqid
End -- end processing for fetched record

CLOSE SpannedGasBillCursor; -- close cursor
DEALLOCATE SpannedGasBillCursor;

END
